physics-grade-9.title: Physics Grade 9
physics-grade-9.description: Foundational physics course covering scientific method, motion, forces, energy, waves, and electricity basics.

physics-grade-10.title: Physics Grade 10
physics-grade-10.description: Intermediate physics covering kinematics, forces, energy, momentum, waves, and electricity with mathematical applications.

physics-grade-11.title: Physics Grade 11
physics-grade-11.description: Comprehensive physics course for grade 11 students covering mechanics, waves, and thermodynamics.

chapters.title: Introduction to Physics
chapters.content: Physics is the natural science that studies matter, its motion and behavior through space and time, and the related entities of energy and force.

chapters.title: Kinematics
chapters.content: Kinematics is the branch of mechanics that describes the motion of points, bodies, and systems of bodies without considering the forces that cause them to move.

chapters.title: Dynamics
chapters.content: Dynamics is the branch of physics developed in classical mechanics concerned with the study of forces and their effects on motion.

chapters.title: Work, Energy and Power
chapters.content: In physics, work is the energy transferred to or from an object via the application of force along a displacement.

questions.text: Which of the following is a vector quantity?
What is the SI unit of force?
According to Newton's first law, an object in motion will:
options: Remain in motion with constant velocity unless acted upon

physics-grade-12.title: Physics Grade 12
physics-grade-12.description: Advanced physics course covering modern physics topics including quantum mechanics, relativity, nuclear physics, and advanced electromagnetic theory.

ap-physics-c-mechanics.title: AP Physics C: Mechanics
ap-physics-c-mechanics.description: Calculus-based physics course focusing on mechanics, including kinematics, Newton's laws, work and energy, systems of particles, linear momentum, circular motion, rotation, oscillations, and gravitation.

ap-physics-c-em.title: AP Physics C: Electricity & Magnetism
ap-physics-c-em.description: Calculus-based physics course covering electrostatics, conductors, capacitors, dielectrics, electric circuits, magnetic fields, and electromagnetism.

algebra-1.title: Algebra 1
algebra-1.description: Foundational algebra course covering algebraic expressions, linear equations, functions, systems of equations, polynomials, factoring, and quadratic equations.

algebra-2.title: Algebra 2
algebra-2.description: Advanced algebra course building on Algebra 1 concepts, covering quadratic functions, polynomials, complex numbers, exponential functions, logarithms, sequences, probability, and trigonometry.

chapters.title: Functions and Their Graphs
chapters.content: A function is a relation between a set of inputs and a set of permissible outputs with the property that each input is related to exactly one output.

chapters.title: Polynomial Functions
chapters.content: A polynomial function is a function that can be expressed in the form of a polynomial. The degree of a polynomial is the highest power of the variable in the polynomial.

chapters.title: Rational Functions
chapters.content: A rational function is any function which can be written as the ratio of two polynomial functions.

chapters.title: Exponential and Logarithmic Functions
chapters.content: Exponential functions model situations where growth or decay is proportional to the current amount.

questions.text: What is the solution to x² - 5x + 6 = 0?
Which of these is a quadratic function?
What is the domain of f(x) = √(x-2)?

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: Comprehensive geometry course covering points, lines, planes, angles, proofs, triangles, polygons, similarity, trigonometry, circles, transformations, area, surface area, and volume.

pre-calculus.title: Pre-Calculus
pre-calculus.description: Advanced mathematics course preparing students for calculus, covering functions, trigonometry, analytic geometry, sequences, series, and an introduction to limits.

ap-calculus.title: AP Calculus
ap-calculus.description: College-level calculus covering limits, derivatives, integrals, and advanced topics in preparation for the AP exam.

chemistry-grade-10.title: Chemistry Grade 10
chemistry-grade-10.description: Foundational chemistry course covering lab safety, states of matter, atomic structure, chemical bonding, reactions, mole concept, acids and bases, and environmental chemistry.

chapters.title: Introduction to Chemistry
chapters.content: Chemistry is the scientific discipline involved with elements and compounds composed of atoms, molecules and ions.

chapters.title: Atomic Structure
chapters.content: An atom is the smallest unit of ordinary matter that forms a chemical element.

chapters.title: Periodic Table
chapters.content: The periodic table is a tabular arrangement of chemical elements, organized by their atomic number, electron configuration, and recurring chemical properties.

chapters.title: Chemical Bonding
chapters.content: A chemical bond is a lasting attraction between atoms, ions or molecules that enables the formation of chemical compounds.

questions.text: How many electrons can the first electron shell hold?
Which element has the atomic number 1?
What type of bond involves the sharing of electron pairs?

chemistry-grade-11.title: Chemistry Grade 11
chemistry-grade-11.description: Intermediate chemistry course covering quantum mechanics, advanced bonding, thermochemistry, quantitative analysis, gas laws, acid-base chemistry, reaction kinetics, equilibrium, thermodynamics, and nuclear chemistry.

chemistry-grade-12.title: Chemistry Grade 12
chemistry-grade-12.description: Advanced chemistry course covering organic chemistry, electrochemistry, thermodynamics, kinetics, coordination chemistry, and nuclear chemistry with emphasis on reaction mechanisms and industrial applications.

biology-grade-9.title: Biology Grade 9
biology-grade-9.description: Foundational biology course covering cell structure, genetics, ecology, plant biology, human body systems, and basic biological principles with emphasis on laboratory safety and scientific inquiry.

biology-grade-10.title: Biology Grade 10
biology-grade-10.description: Intermediate biology course covering biochemistry, cellular processes, genetics, evolution, human physiology, and ecology with emphasis on molecular biology and systems interactions.

biology-grade-11.title: Biology Grade 11
biology-grade-11.description: Advanced biology course covering cellular biology, molecular genetics, biotechnology, evolutionary theory, human physiology, and ecosystem dynamics with emphasis on biochemical pathways and genetic mechanisms.

biology-grade-12.title: Biology Grade 12
biology-grade-12.description: Advanced biology course covering biochemistry, molecular genetics, human physiology, biotechnology, environmental biology, and evolutionary biology with emphasis on current research and applications.

ap-microeconomics.title: AP Microeconomics
ap-microeconomics.description: College-level microeconomics covering individual markets, consumer behavior, firm decision-making, and market structures.
